N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 25.7 - Exceptions

State Regulations
(a) No provision of this Part shall be deemed
to limit the ability of a facility to hire any patient or former patient in
accordance with regular employment practices of the facility. (b) This Part shall not apply to patients who
volunteer to participate in an organized system of volunteer services, provided
that: (1)
the patient has the mental capacity
to volunteer, does volunteer, and a written record of the determination of
mental capacity is retained in the patient's clinical record; (2)
such services would not be compensated by
the facility if performed by a person other than a patient; (3)
such work shall be directed and
supervised in accordance with the patient's individual service plan; and
(4)
a record of such volunteer
work shall be maintained in accordance with section
25.6
of this Part. (c) This Part shall not apply to
clients who reside and work within an integrated residential community pursuant
to sections
27.2
(g) and
27.3
(f) of this

Title. However: (1)
an integrated residential
community shall design and implement a means to ensure that clients are
protected from exploitation; and
(2)
under no conditions shall a client of an
integrated residential community be permitted to perform work tasks or
activities without appropriate supervision or perform on equipment and under
conditions which do not adequately provide for the client's health, safety and
welfare. Notes
